item.title: Fine Art Printing
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text align="left"]

LightSource makes the best prints. Period.

We offer artists and photographers the utmost color brilliance, technical skill, and material archivability for gallery, display and portfolio.

[/vc_column_text][rs_space height="25px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_tta_accordion][vc_tta_section title="OUR PRINTS" tab_id="1466584428447-c2aedc10-b4df"][vc_column_text]Our fine art prints are ideal for museum and home display, gallery editions, premium retail, and portfolios. We currently print on Epson Signature Worthy & Epson Legacy premium papers, Hahnemuhle Photo Rag premium papers. These are archival, acid-free, cotton rag and cotton fiber papers with minimal brighteners (OBAs). We also offer Epson Photo Glossy and Semi-Matte, Sunset Metallic Gloss, Fredrix Canvas, rice paper, washi papers, and more. We also make plexiglass facemounts, and prints on metal! Our prices are based on printing directly from your file. For prints made from film, additional scanning charges apply. If you'd like retouch work performed, we are happy to provide you an estimate. We charge $120/hr in quarter hour increments of $30.

Print Edition Prices

Artists looking for museum-quality yet affordable print editions need look no further. Inkjet printing is the ideal choice for artists wishing to print editions on an as-needed basis, instead of committing to a large run–and large price tag–all at once. We offer great edition pricing–up to 50% off. Give us a call for a specific quote.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="OUR PAPERS" tab_id="1466584428518-d3d0531f-88ae"][vc_column_text]

Premium Paper Prints

Not sure where to start? For a semi-glossy sheen, try Epson Platine. If you prefer a matte finish, we recommend Epson Hot Press Bright. Feel free to contact us for suggestions! Here is a detailed list of our current offerings:
  • Epson Legacy Platine (glossy) New! Bright white cotton fiber paper with glossy finish
  • Epson Legacy Baryta (glossy) New! Bright white cellulose fiber paper with glossy finish 
  • Epson Legacy Etching (matte) New! Bright white cotton fiber paper with matte finish and just the right amount of tooth
  • Epson Signature Worthy Hot Press Bright (matte) Dazzling white cotton rag paper with luxuriously smooth matte finish
  • Epson Signature Worthy Cold Press Bright (textured) Bright white cotton rag paper with softly textured matte finish
  • Epson Signature Worthy Cold Press Natural (textured) Natural white cotton rag paper with softly textured matte finish
  • Epson Signature Worthy Exhibition Watercolor (textured) Natural white cotton rag paper with unique texture of a fine watercolor print
  • Epson Photo Gloss Bright white glossy RC-style paper yielding highly saturated images, while maintaining excellent highlight and shadow detail. 198 GSM, medium-weight paper.
  • Epson Photo Satin Bright white semi-gloss RC-style paper, similar to a pearl-finish RC paper. Archival testing on all of these materials can be found at Willhelm Research.
  • Hahnemühle Photo Rag Pearl (semi-gloss) Cotton rag paper with semi-gloss surface similar to air-dried fibre based traditional prints. This heavy (320 GSM) paper prints beautifully in both color and B&W. One of our finest!
  • Hahnemühle Photo Rag Baryta (gloss) Cotton rag paper with glossy surface. This heavy (315 GSM) paper prints beautifully in both color and B&W.
  • Hahnemühle Photo Rag 308 (matte) 100% Cotton rag paper with a matte finish. This heavy (308 GSM) paper is a great choice if you want a heavy weight paper with a smooth flat finish. This is a favorite of ours.
  • Hahnemühle William Turner Watercolor (textured) Heavy (310 GSM) matte surface cotton paper with a watercolor texture. This is a genuine mould-made paper, ideal for textured artwork reproductions.
  • LexJet Sunset Photo Metallic High-gloss medium (255GSM) RC photo paper. The unique metallic finish results in prints that are sharp, vibrant, and exceptionally rich-looking.
  • Fredrix Sunset Canvas Fredrix has been producing artist canvas since 1868. Specifically designed for inkjet printing, Fredrix Sunset canvas delivers intense color saturation and image sharpness with a pleasing satin finish. All of this is achieved without the use of optical brighteners or synthetic fibers. A great choice for artists and photographers who want to make a bold statement with their work. We offer these canvases finished with a custom UV-protectant coating, with a mirrored gallery wrap stretched on a wooden frame.

Special Projects

We can also print on a variety of fabrics, Japanese Washi papers, DisplayTrans media for lightboxes, and more. Give us a call to discuss your project![/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="OUR PRINTERS & INKS" tab_id="1466584849231-7345e77e-a436"][vc_column_text]Our prints are produced with professional grade Canon ImagePrograf printers, using brilliant wide-gamut LUCIA inks[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_accordion][rs_space height="25px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column align="center"][rs_section_title align="center" title="Inkjet Print Pricing"][vc_column_text]

item.title: Art Capture
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column width="1/6"][vc_column_text align="center"] [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="2/3"][vc_column_text]

Two. Hundred. Million. Pixels.

Our Hasselblad H4D-200MS’s amazing 200MP resolution brings unprecedented detail and resolution to LightSource's Digital Captures. The H4D-200MS is used in-house by the MoMA, the Smithsonian, the Metropolitan Museum of Art, and the Tate Gallery of London. When the absolutely highest degree of museum-quality color and resolution is required, LightSource is the ONLY place to get your artwork digitized.

That's the LightSource Advantage.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/6"][vc_column_text] [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][rs_space height="75px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row attachment="fixed" class="banner-section"][vc_column class_type="sm" width="1/2" animation="fadeInUp"][rs_image_block image="3322"][/vc_column][vc_column class_type="sm" width="1/2" animation="fadeInUp" class="banner-image"][rs_image_block image="3324"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][rs_space height="100px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_tta_accordion][vc_tta_section title="What is artwork capture?" tab_id="1466667182335-2326a569-6a66"][vc_column_text]It’s kinda like scanning, but much better! Whether you want to reproduce your art as a fine art printing edition or just want a digital version for your website, our captures are where it's at. We use a very high resolution digital camera to photograph your work under controlled studio conditions. The captured image is then carefully adjusted in postproduction, and output to you in 16 bits. This technical workflow gives us the utmost precision in capturing the essence of your art. If you wish to accentuate the texture of raised brush strokes in your art, we can capture those strokes by using differential lighting to enhance the shadows and detail. The effect in the final print can be astounding, creating a three dimensional look that has a pronounced effect on the viewer. We have an immense amount of experience digitizing original artwork, having captured over 5,000 artworks in 8 years. This amount of experience is required when making the best museum quality reproductions of your artwork.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Why do I need the best captures?" tab_id="1466667182413-1b08bf81-809a"][vc_column_text]Why do I need the best possible captures? It’s your art, and you know how hard you worked on it. Now it’s time to show it off. Whether you’d like to sell your editioned prints, send your digitized portfolio to prospective galleries, or produce a faithful reproduction for publishing, digital captures from LightSource are the best option available anywhere. It’s not just a question of just obtaining a large enough file size for the print you want us to make. It’s also matter of achieving superior color accuracy, tonal control, dynamic range, and rendering of fine detail. From our new Hasselblad H4D-200MS captures to premiere post-processing, all these qualities are combined to make a faithful reproduction of your original art. When you need the absolute best captures, LightSource delivers. Our Hasselblad H4D-200MS, boasting 200 million pixels (200MP), produces the highest-possible resolution digital capture of your original artwork. We are the only shop in Northern California with this capability! We can capture 2D works of any size. Bring your artwork to our shop at your convenience, or schedule an appointment with a capture technician. Special Offer! Save up to 20% on your digital captures when you bring in three or more artworks of a similar size.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="The Identical Reproduction" tab_id="1466667580508-276b626a-21a4"][vc_column_text]

We can capture many kinds of 2D artwork. Here are some of them:

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text class="32col"]
  • Works on paper, including pencil & pastel
  • Oil & acrylic paintings
  • Watercolors
  • Fabric, Textiles, and Fiber Art
  • Glass plate negatives
  • Tintypes
  • Original & historic photographs
  • Historic documents & papers
  • Scrolls
  • 2D Memorabilia
  • Animation Cells
  • Blueprints
[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_accordion][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][rs_space height="100px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/4"][rs_pricing_table icon="fa fa-camera" feature="200MB 16 bit capture, for prints up to 24``" currency="$" price="50" btn_text="Call now" title="Small" link="url:http%3A%2F%2Fwww.lightsourcesf.com%2Fcontact-us%2F|||"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][rs_pricing_table icon="fa fa-camera" feature="500MB 16 bit capture for prints up to 40``" currency="$" price="75" btn_text="Call now" title="Medium" link="url:http%3A%2F%2Fwww.lightsourcesf.com%2Fcontact-us%2F|||"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][rs_pricing_table icon="fa fa-camera" feature="750MB 16 bit capture for prints up to 60``" currency="$" price="150" btn_text="Call now" title="Large" link="url:http%3A%2F%2Fwww.lightsourcesf.com%2Fcontact-us%2F|||"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][rs_pricing_table icon="fa fa-camera" feature="1GB 16 bit capture for prints up to 72``" currency="$" price="200" btn_text="Call now" title="X-Large" link="url:http%3A%2F%2Fwww.lightsourcesf.com%2Fcontact-us%2F|||"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][rs_space height="100px"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Artwork capture means scanning your art for reproduction, fine art print editions, or digital display, using a 200MP Hasselblad camera and studio lighting.

item.title: Film Scanning
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]

Heidelberg S3900 & Primescan D8200

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][vc_column_text align="left"]

Your images are precious. When you need to scan film for a print, book or exhibit, it is vitally important to get the best quality drum scans available. At LightSource we use the best drum scanners ever made: The Heidelberg S3900 for transparencies, B&W negatives and reflective (non-transparent) art, and the Primescan D8200 for color negatives.

item.title: LightSource SF - Fine Art Inkjet Printing Film Scanning Artwork Captures Plexi Facemounts
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text][rev_slider_vc alias="SplashMain"][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row padding="custom-padding" top="40px" bottom="40px"][vc_column][vc_column_text][rs_space height="25px"][rs_section_title align="center" title="Services" show_right="no" right_title="MORE ABOUT US"][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column][vc_tabs style="with_icon" active="1" class="tpl-tabs-cont1"][vc_tab icon="icon-printer" title="Printing" tab_id="1426755875-1-795c27-4e25"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][rs_blockquote] LightSource makes the best prints, period.  [/rs_blockquote][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="3/4"][vc_column_text align="left"]We offer artists and photographers the best archival fine art inkjet prints possible for gallery, display and portfolio. We strive to bring your vision to life in the final print. We believe in uncompromising quality, and the proof is in the pudding.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tab][vc_tab icon="icon-camera" title="Art Capture" tab_id="1426757067758-4-45c27-4e25"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][rs_blockquote]Two. Hundred. Million. Pixels.  The best camera in the Bay![/rs_blockquote][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="3/4"][vc_column_text align="left"]Our 200MP Hasselblad H4D camera captures the highest quality digital rendition of your original artwork. We can capture original art of any size. When you need the absolute best captures, LightSource delivers.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tab][vc_tab icon="icon-focus" title="Drum Scanning" tab_id="1426755875-3-345c27-4e25"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][rs_blockquote]Precision scanners, made in Germany. Das ist gut![/rs_blockquote][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="3/4"][vc_column_text align="left"]Our Heidelberg S3900 and Primescan D8200 drum scanners extract every bit of detail that exists in your film. We take extreme care in optimizing your scan to ensure all the highlights and shadows in your film are preserved.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tab][vc_tab icon="icon-pictures" title="Mounting" tab_id="1426755875-2-745c27-4e25"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][rs_blockquote] Transform your prints into beautiful wall art! [/rs_blockquote][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="3/4"][vc_column_text align="left"]Finishing options add the perfect touch, lamination, birch and bamboo panels, and aluminum mounting, and more. Try plexiglass facemounting for a bold, modern feel. The acrylic draws in light, creating a captivating frameless presentation. Ask us for a custom quote![/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tab][vc_tab icon="icon-linegraph" title="B2B Services" tab_id="1426757034378-3-75c27-4e25"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/4"][rs_blockquote]LightSource B2B: On Point.[/rs_blockquote][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="3/4"][vc_column_text align="left"]We tailor our business-to-business services to your needs, including pre-production imaging & printing, rush turnaround, and on-time delivery. We offer high-end low-minimum retail production services, right here in San Francisco. Give us a call to discuss your project.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tab][/vc_tabs][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row padding="pt-70 pb-70 pt-xs-50 pb-xs-50"][vc_column][vc_column_text][rev_slider_vc alias="TestimonialsMain"][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row margin="custom-margin" m_top="0px" m_bottom="140px"][vc_column][vc_column_text][rs_section_title align="center" title="FIND US " show_right="no" right_title="MORE ABOUT US" top="25px"][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/6"][vc_column_text] [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="2/3"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3" class="col-sm-6"][rs_contact_details icon="fa fa-phone" title="Call Us" content_size="15px"] 415 621 1448 [/rs_contact_details][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3" class="col-sm-6"][rs_contact_details icon="fa fa-map-marker" title="Find Us" title_size="12px" content_size="15px"]1661 Tennessee St. #2W, San Francisco, CA 94107[/rs_contact_details][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3" class="col-sm-6"][rs_contact_details icon="fa fa-envelope" title="Write Us" content_size="15px"]orders@lightsourcesf.com[/rs_contact_details][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text]CYCLISTS: You are welcome to bring bicycles inside. COMMUTERS: The Muni "T" line is only a block away. The 22 bus is about a 10 minute walk. DRIVERS: We are located close to both the 280 and 101. Street parking only. Look for spots along Cesar Chavez St. TO ENTER: Dial 406# on the Tennessee St. call box, and we'll buzz you in. Take the elevator or stairs to the 2nd floor, and turn right at the end of the hall.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/6"][vc_column_text] [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row attachment="fixed" padding="custom-padding" bgcolor="#f8f8f8" top="120" bottom="20"][vc_column animation="fadeInRight"][vc_column_text][rs_space height="50px"][rs_section_title align="left" title="Instagram Feed" show_right="yes" right_title="Follow us on Instagram" link="url:http%3A%2F%2Finstagram.com%2Flightsource_sf||target:%20_blank" top="60px" bottom="15px"][vc_column_text] [instagram-feed] [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row padding="custom-padding" margin="custom-margin" bgcolor="#0f0f0f" top="50px" bottom="70px" m_top="0" m_bottom="0"][vc_column][vc_column_text][rs_space height="100px"][rs_cta heading="READY TO PLACE YOUR ORDER?" btn_text="Upload Image" heading_color="rgba(255,255,255,0.9)" link="url:http%3A%2F%2Flightsourcesf.com%2Forder-now%2F|title:Upload|"][rs_space height="100px"][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text class="font-alt"]

We believe in uncompromising quality.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/3"][rs_feature_box box_style="style2" icon="fa fa-star" title="Quality" icon_color="#0a0a0a" title_color="#0a0a0a" text_color="#0a0a0a" icon_size="40px" title_size="25px" content_size="14px"]You want the best, and we bring the best. We choose the best materials, workflow, and equipment to bring the best results.[/rs_feature_box][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][rs_feature_box box_style="style2" icon="fa fa-picture-o" title="Craft" icon_color="#0a0a0a" title_color="#0a0a0a" text_color="#0a0a0a" icon_size="50px" title_size="25px" content_size="14px"]Every print, scan, and capture is manually adjusted and checked for perfection. We take great pride in crafting our work, and it shows.[/rs_feature_box][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][rs_feature_box box_style="style2" icon="fa fa-users" title="Experience" icon_color="#0a0a0a" title_color="#0a0a0a" text_color="#0a0a0a" icon_size="50px" title_size="25px" content_size="14px"]Our technicians have over 40 years of combined experience. We are artists too, so we understand your high standards of perfection.[/rs_feature_box][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row attachment="fixed" bgcolor="rgba(255,255,255,0.31)"][vc_column][rs_space height="40px"][rs_section_title align="center" title="OUR TEAM" title_color="#0a0a0a" title_size="26px"][rs_space height="30px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row padding="custom-padding" top="20px" bottom="20px"][vc_column][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3" animation="fadeInUp" animation_delay=".3" class="col-sm-6"][rs_team person_id="2332"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3" animation="fadeInUp" animation_delay=".5" class="col-sm-6"][rs_team person_id="1750"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3" animation="fadeInUp" animation_delay=".5"][rs_team person_id="2971"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3" animation="fadeInUp" animation_delay=".7" class="col-sm-6"][rs_team person_id="2972"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3" animation="fadeInUp" animation_delay=".3" class="col-sm-6"][rs_team person_id="1752"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3" animation="fadeInUp" animation_delay=".7"][rs_team person_id="1751"][vc_column_text]

item.title: Paper Info
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded:
Epson Signature Worthy Premium Papers

Epson Signature Worthy Hot Press Bright Dazzling white paper with luxuriously smooth matte finish Epson Signature Worthy Cold Press Bright Bright white paper with softly textured matte finish Epson Signature Worthy Cold Press Natural Natural white paper with softly textured matte finish Epson Signature Worthy Exhibition Watercolor Natural white paper with unique texture of a fine watercolor print
 

Hahnemuhle Premium Premium Papers

Hahnemühle Photo Rag Pearl Cotton rag paper with semi-gloss surface similar to air-dried fibre based traditional prints. This heavy (320 GSM) paper prints beautifully in both color and B&W with our Canon printers. Hahnemühle Photo Rag Matte Cotton rag paper with a matte finish. This heavy (308 GSM) paper is a great choice if you want a heavy weight paper with a smooth flat finish. This is a favorite of ours. Hahnemühle William Turner Heavy (310 GSM) matte surface cotton paper with a watercolour texture. This is a genuine mould-made paper, ideal for textured artwork reproductions.
 

More Premium Papers

Breathing Color Lyve Canvas The highest-quality premium canvas on the market today. Specifically designed to deliver intense color saturation and image sharpness with a pleasing satin finish. All of this is achieved without the use of optical brighteners. A great choice for artists and photographers who want to make a bold statement with their work. We offer these canvases finished with a custom UV-protectant coating, with a mirrored gallery wrap stretched on a wooden frame. LexJet Sunset Photo Metallic High-gloss medium (255GSM) RC photo paper. The unique metallic finish results in prints that are sharp, vibrant, and exceptionally rich-looking. Lexjet Sunset Hot Press Rag (premium archival matte paper) Epson Cold Press Rag (textured similar to watercolor paper or matte board) Hahnemuhle Fine Art Baryta (Premium glossy cotton-based paper) Hahnemuhle Bamboo (90% bamboo fibers, a renewable resource) Ilford Galerie Prestige Smooth Gloss (premium glossy RC paper)
 

Standard Papers

Epson Glossy Bright white glossy paper which yields highly saturated images while maintaining excellent highlight and shadow detail. 198 GSM, medium-weight paper. Epson Satin Acid free 100% cotton hot press paper that features an ultra smooth finish on two sides which is also Ph buffered with calcium carbonate for a true archival sheet. 250 GSM, medium-weight paper. Standard Matte Bright white paper with a flat matte surface that yields highly saturated images while maintaining excellent highlight and shadow detail. 198 GSM, medium-weight paper. Archival testing on all of these materials can be found at Willhelm Research.
 

Special Projects

We can also print on a variety of fabrics, and DisplayTrans media for lightboxes. Give us a call to discuss your project! Call us at (415)621-1448

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.content:encoded: This privacy policy discloses the privacy practices for http://lightsource-sf.com/. This privacy policy applies solely to information collected by this web site. It will notify you of the following: What personally identifiable information is collected from you through the web site, how it is used and with whom it may be shared. What choices are available to you regarding the use of your data. The security procedures in place to protect the misuse of your information. How you can correct any inaccuracies in the information. Information Collection, Use, and Sharing We are the sole owners of the information collected on this site. We only have access to/collect information that you voluntarily give us via email or other direct contact from you. We will not sell or rent this information to anyone. We will use your information to respond to you, regarding the reason you contacted us. We will not share your information with any third party outside of our organization, other than as necessary to fulfill your request, e.g. to ship an order. Unless you ask us not to, we may contact you via email in the future to tell you about specials, new products or services, or changes to this privacy policy. Your Access to and Control Over Information You may opt out of any future contacts from us at any time. You can do the following at any time by contacting us via the email address or phone number given on our website: • See what data we have about you, if any. • Change/correct any data we have about you. • Have us delete any data we have about you. • Express any concern you have about our use of your data. Security We take precautions to protect your information. When you submit sensitive information via the website, your information is protected both online and offline. Wherever we collect sensitive information (such as credit card data), that information is encrypted and transmitted to us in a secure way. You can verify this by looking for a closed lock icon at the bottom of your web browser, or looking for "https" at the beginning of the address of the web page. While we use encryption to protect sensitive information transmitted online, we also protect your information offline. Only employees who need the information to perform a specific job (for example, billing or customer service) are granted access to personally identifiable information. The computers/servers in which we store personally identifiable information are kept in a secure environment. Updates Our Privacy Policy may change from time to time and all updates will be posted on this page. If you feel that we are not abiding by this privacy policy, you should contact us immediately via telephone at: 415-621-1448 or via email at contact@lightsourcesf.com.

item.title: Mounting
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text align="left"]

Mounting Options

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text align="left"]

We offer a wide range of mounting and presentation solutions for your prints. Email us with the specifics of your project and we can explain our options in further detail, match the best solution to your prints, and give you a custom quote.

[/vc_column_text][rs_space height="25px"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text align="center"][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_tta_accordion][vc_tta_section title="PLEXI FACE MOUNT" tab_id="1466584428447-c2aedc10-b4dfe4c4-6711"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]Sometimes called Acrylic Photo Printing, plexiglass facemounts are give your images a bold, modern feel. Your print is displayed behind clear, high-gloss Plexiglass, available in 1/8", 3/16", 1/4", 1/2", or 3/4" thickness. Plexi draws in light into your print making it almost 3D, creating a captivating presentation for gallery and high-end corporate environments. Paper options for this style of mounting are Gloss and Metallic. Non-glare Plexi is also available.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][rs_space height="10px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]The backing can be either 1/16” polished aluminum or ⅛” black epanel (aka dibond). For smaller sizes, bamboo and Sintra are also available.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][rs_space height="10px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]For facemounted prints, we recommend a recessed aluminum backframe. Because the recessed backframe is hidden from view, the facemounted print “floats” an inch off the wall. [/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="E-PANEL" tab_id="1467876589930-5d3b71d2-ae8f"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text]A great mounting option for a clean, durable finish. Also known as DiBond, E-panel has a black composite polymer material sandwiched between two thin sheets of aluminum. Available in 4mm thickness, about ⅛”. Combined with a recessed back frame, E-Panel mounting  creates a bold statement that fits with modern or traditional decor. A great rigid yet lightweight backing option for facemounts![/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="ALUMINUM" tab_id="1467876746431-c0b142f8-e787"][vc_column_text]A unique, stylish, and very durable mounting option. Your image is fused to the ultra-high gloss aluminum surface. With a similar look to E-panel, aluminum has an edge that is a solid silver color compared to the black and silver of E-panel. Highly recommended as a backing for facemounts![/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="SINTRA" tab_id="1467877148883-278bfeae-24e6"][vc_column_text]Composite polymer backings for a clean, durable presentation. Sintra is available in black or white, 6mm or 12mm thickness, and in our opinion is ideally matched with a Face Mount for a superior gallery or corporate setting.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="GATORBOARD" tab_id="1467877279455-6512ea0e-af12"][vc_column_text]Our most popular option! Made of durable and lightweight Polystyrene foam, Gatorboard is available in black and white,  3/16” and ½” thicknesses. Gatorboard is preferable over Foam Core because it is less susceptible to divots and warping. Add UV lamination for an economical and durable presentation![/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="UV LAMINATION" tab_id="1467877358554-d9fdc591-9d14"][vc_column_text]Smooth finish and additional protection, available in Satin and Matte.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][/vc_tta_accordion][rs_space height="25px"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][rs_section_title align="center" title="We'd Love To Hear From You!"][vc_column_text]

Feel free to contact us. If we can discuss the details of your project, we can give you a better quote.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Plexi facemounts! Our plexiglass facemounting (aka acrylic prints) creates a beautiful modern look. We also mount to aluminum, dibond, epanel, and sintra.

item.title: Atlas Skateboarding x NikeSB
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded: Photographers Joe Brooke and Mark Whiteley recently did a collaboration with Atlas Skateboarding and NikeSB! We printed these epic skate photos for their opening at Atlas Skateboarding last month. About Photographer Joe Brooke: Despite using a medium known primarily for the ability to record events precisely as they occurred, the best photographers produce work that tells that story, but also leaves you wondering. They inspire awe, and many unanswerable questions. There are few photographers who can match Joe Brook in that beautiful balancing act. By virtue of his trade as visual chronicler for an irreverent and disruptive youth culture media outlet known the world over, Joe is regularly embedded in moments where key elements of the story must be made plain as proof of occurrence, while other elements must remain shrouded in mystery. The Who, yes; the What, often; the Where and When, occasionally; but the Why and the How, never. That is the magic. Joe dances with the elements in a playful way, everybody at ease while turning them into participants in the moment as only he can see it. He moves effortlessly in every scenario, constantly looking, finding the angles, and capturing the ephemera before you even notice he has done it.But all that delicacy aside, Joe Brook is a workhorse of monstrous and epic proportion. Joe grinds it out like none other, never once quitting or shying away. No excuses. His work ethic borders on the puritanical, and both his long list of friends and his curriculum vitae speak to his skills. Joe has graced the pages and pixels of a crème- de-la-créme roll call of outlets, including Thrasher, Juxtapoz, Rolling Stone, PDN, Kodak, Lodown, and countless others, but he will never tell you about that. He’s too busy shooting 100 portraits of you that will capture your inner spirit, and leave you wondering how you never saw yourself as clearly as he did. The whole time he’ll be smiling. Web: http://joebrook.com/ About Photographer Mark Whiteley: Mark Whiteley is a photographer, writer and life-long skateboarder hailing from the San Francisco are and currently living in Portland, OR. He served as the editor-in-chief of SLAP skateboard magazine for 13 years and now works on all things digital for Nike Skateboarding. His work has been featured by the likes of Juxtapose, Thrasher, The San Francisco Chronicle and San Francisco Exploratorium and Leica, and he has exhibited internationally. Mark's monograph of photography, This is Not A Photo Opportunity, is available from Gingko Press. http://markwhiteleyphotography.com/

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Photographers Joe Brooke & Mark Whiteley recently did a collaboration with Atlas Skateboarding & NikeSB! We printed these epic skate photos for their show.
Atlas Skateboarding x Nike SB | Light Source SF

item.title: Pardon Our Dust...
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded:
...while LightSource expands into this amazing new studio.

Announcing the Grand Opening of our new studio 2W!

Don't worry, it's right across the hall from the old one.

In addition to doubling our floor space, we've set up a beautiful gallery in the front to showcase some of our most stunning client work. From international contemporary artists like Isabelle Menin and Zhou Hongbin, to local favorites like Susan Middleton and Peter Samuels, the works on display will reflect the diverse range of creatives with whom LightSource loves to work. The numerous designers and art directors who look to us as a art resource for local artists will always have something new and brilliant to see on display.

Forging the connections between makers and buyers is what really makes LightSource stand head and shoulders above the crowd.

We’ve also expanded our workforce, adding three printing and imaging technicians and a color management specialist. Come say hello!

item.title: Saturday Open House at Studio 2W
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded: LightSource welcomes you to visit our gallery, Studio 2W, as part of this weekend's First Saturday. Reception hours will be 5-8 pm on Saturday, August 6th, at 1661 Tennessee St, #2W on the second floor. We feature large format prints tailored to designers for corporate and residential projects. Some of our artists include Peter Samuels, Trevor Mansfield, Frank Schott, Howard Schatz, Thea Schrack and Isabelle Menin. After visiting Studio 2W, check out the 16 galleries nearby at the brand new Minnesota Street Project! This Saturday August 6, 5-8 PM 1661 Tennessee St #2W, San Francisco, CA 94107 More details on our facebook page, which you can see here: https://www.facebook.com/events/1668185210172329/

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I see interesting content here. Your site can go viral easily, you need some initial traffic only. There is a sneaky method to get massive traffic from social media. Search in google for: Twinor's strategy

item.title: Another busy day, in slow motion
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded: Another day in the office, big prints are everywhere! On the wall, coming out of the printer, and walking out the front door. It's a busy start to 2017! The first piece shown is Carrara, 2016, a metal print, by Frank Schott (@schottsf). Frank spent many hours in the cold hiking a mountain in the Italian Alps to take this shot! The piece being walked out the door is Kazakh Wedding Singer Smoking, 2016, a fine art print on Epson Hot Press Bright, by Dimitri Staszewski (@dimitri.photo).  Dimitri is back in Mongolia now and we look forward to seeing his next round of work!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Busy, busy! Everything large format! The first is a metal print for Frank Schott, the second is a fine art print for Dimitri Staszewski.

item.title: Michael Zagaris and Brad Mangin team up with the San Francisco Baseball Academy!
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_4167" align="alignnone" width="640"] Brad Mangin and Michael Zagaris have teamed up with the San Francisco Baseball Academy![/caption] About Michael Zagaris: In the late 1970s, Zagaris began photographing sports. He has photographed 34 Super Bowls, 12 World Series, and 14 All Star games. www.zagaris.photoshelter.com. Zagaris trusts his film scanning and fine art printing exclusively to LightSource. About Brad Mangin: Mangin is a San Francisco based baseball photographer, he follows teams all the way from spring training to the World Series! He also photographs golf tournaments for the PGA. See his work at www.manginphotography.com About the San Francisco Baseball Academy: Located in Laurel Heights, SFBA's staff consists of Bay Area coaches dedicated to personal growth in every player, whether in one-on-one or group sessions.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Longtime bay area music and sports photographer Michael Zagaris trusts his film scanning and fine art printing exclusively to LightSource SF.

item.title: Fine Art Prints, Ready to Roll!
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded: Lots of 30"x40" staging prints waiting to be trimmed and shipped off to their final destination!

item.title: By the Light of the Moon - Jeanne Hauser's Lunagram - artwork capture and fine art print
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded: Jeanne Hauser standing with one of her "lunagrams", a print made by exposing a piece of light-sensitive darkroom photographic paper to the light of the moon. The silhouettes are captured by placing the objects onto the paper itself. LightSource captured her original lunagram and enlarged it for this large format fine art print on Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Pearl, our most popular paper. The finished print is mounted to epanel, and "floats" off the wall with a recessed aluminum backframe. It looks great! We plan to make a second one soon. See more of Jeanne Hauser's work at www.jeannehauser.com. The lunagrams can be found here: http://jeannehauser.com/galleries/lunagrams/

item.title: It's all in the details
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded: Frank Schott (www.frankschott.com) and Ward Long take a look at a test strip for Frank's 60"x80" fine art print of a Carrara marble mine in Italy. We make test strips of the final print until the color and contrast are just right! Photographers like Frank Schott come to LightSource to work one-on-one with the highest skilled technicians in the Bay Area.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Frank Schott reviews a test strip with Ward. This is a crucial step in producing the best fine art print possible. For us, it's all in the details.

item.title: Plexiglass Facemounts, Acrylic Photo Prints, a Great Choice for Interior Designers
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded: This diptych was made for JBI Designs (www.jbidesigns.com) for a now very happy client of theirs! The gorgeous image was provided by photographer Russ Eddy, printed at 9.6 feet tall by 15 feet wide, and sandwiched between two pieces of plexiglass. We love how they turned out! Plexiglass facemounts, sometimes called acrylic photo printing, are very popular with interior designers such as JBI Designs, and when you see one, you see why. Visit our studio to see some more examples of acrylic prints and plexi glass facemounts.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: We love how these turned out! Plexiglass facemounts andacrylic photo printing, are very popular with interior designers and when you see one, you see why.

item.title: Longtime LightSource client Jenny Odell editions a new print through Kickstarter
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded:
In her own words:

The Satellite Collections are a series of digital prints in which I collect, cut out, and arrange manmade structures from Google Maps' satellite imagery. These typologies remove things like swimming pools and basketball courts from their familiar environments so that we might consider them in more detail. For my latest print, 681 Observatory Domes, Telescopes, and Other Structures for Long Range Observation, I spent upwards of 50 hours collecting and cutting out observational structures both big and small. The satellite perspective seems especially appropriate here, since it's from these white dots and circles that Earth dwellers look out at the realm in which satellites operate -- and beyond. They're reflective of a planetary sense of being. The structures are collected from 43 different countries and include important sites in typically barren locations, like the 1000-foot-wide radio telescope in Arecibo, Chile, the observatories atop Mauna Kea, and the Very Large Array in New Mexico. But also included here are the small observatories, often found in a field on the edge of town or attached to a high school, that represent the efforts of astronomy clubs and curious amateurs. These observatories are also memorials; many of them are named after local scientists. More generally, my collection is meant as a meditation on observation and the poetic qualities of scale. It configures the domes into their own constellation; the sizes of the domes are not reflective of actual size, but of resolution in that area (the size that was available at the most zoomed-in level). I've also, in cutting these out, stayed true to the way they appear on Google Maps, so some of them are distorted in ways that betray the 3D mapping that captured them. In that sense, this print is as much about imaging as it is about images. what you're getting I will be using this image to produce an edition of 100 24"x24" prints with Lightsource SF, a printer I have worked with for over six years. These will be printed on a Canon imagePROGRAF iPF9400 with the LUCIA EX Ink Set, on Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Pearl, a 100% cotton acid-free paper designed for archival inkjet prints. Each print will also come with a certificate of authenticity, signed by me and indicating the edition number. A list of all the observatories, telescopes, etc. in the print will also be included. People sometimes assume that prints using web-based imagery will be blurry and low-resolution. Although the resolution varies among the domes due to the variance on Google Maps, the print as a whole is high resolution. In other words, this print was designed to reward long periods of close looking. more about me I am a Bay Area native / captive (born a few miles from where the Google headquarters would eventually be!). I teach design and internet art at Stanford University. For many, many years my own work has involved collecting and systematizing imagery from Google Maps as well as other online ephemera -- Craigslist photos, YouTube screen shots, etc. My goal has been to provide a momentary alienation from the familiar and everyday, in order to provide access to the bizarre and unexpected that is right underneath it. I'm specifically attracted to satellite imagery because of the ways in which it captures "human things" from a distant, automated perspective that a human was never meant to inhabit. From this view, the specificity and fragility of the built environment comes into full focus. more about the satellite collections See some other Satellite Collections here; read the Satellite Collections essay here. The Satellite Collections have been featured in TIME's LightBox as well as in a mural on the side of a Google data center.

item.title: What our clients say about us.
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded: "I have a wide experience working with professional labs, not only in the US but also in Europe. I have to say that LightSource had exceed my expectations. Sam is not only very responsive and kind, but he goes beyond to keep you happy and help you with your business as much as he can. The customer service is excellent and all the deliverables are incredible good. With them I don't need to look further, they have all I was looking for in a professional lab."

item.title: What our clients say about us.
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded: I've worked with LightSource on a per-project basis for a few years now and they are terrific; super responsive and helpful with questions (I'm an interior designer not a photographer). I've primarily worked with Cassi and she's always service oriented and honest (read: great about managing expectations). The clients that I've referred to Cassi and LightSource also say the same thing. I've used Blow Up lab and a few other labs in the city but these guys are the best to work with attitude wise. Many thanks for a great experience each and every time I work with you guys, LightSource!!

item.title: What our clients say about us.
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded: Sam, JP and Cassi, I cannot thank you enough for such a wonderful experience with my canvas printing. They look way better than I could have ever imagined. This is an excellent place to have real high quality canvas prints made.

item.title: What our clients say about us.
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded: Absolutely the best - professional, cost-conscious, fast turnaround, responsive. The output of our recent print exceeded expectations. They really are as good as I could ever hope for and I will send them all of my work in the future.

item.title: Sean Foulkes
item.dc:creator: SteveShearer
item.content:encoded: Sean is a Photoshop wizard and our resident mounting & coating genius. The spray booth - his home away from home.
